24:I[78891,["529","static/chunks/529-b3a318fab494e03f.js","244","static/chunks/244-f8e89f92ed6eb924.js","839","static/chunks/839-b514104c7e948606.js","165","static/chunks/165-ae3b45f0d86ef78d.js","184","static/chunks/app/dashboard/roots/%5Broot%5D/page-e0a9e2c37c8cb20d.js"],"CardTitle"]
25:T4dc,You who believe, when you contract a debt for a stated term, put it down in writing: have a scribe write it down justly between you. No scribe should refuse to write: let him write as God has taught him, let the debtor dictate, and let him fear God, his Lord, and not diminish &#91;the debt&#93; at all. If the debtor is feeble-minded, weak, or unable to dictate, then let his guardian dictate justly. Call in two men as witnesses. If two men are not there, then call one man and two women out of those you approve as witnesses, so that if one of the two women should forget the other can remind her. Let the witnesses not refuse when they are summoned. Do not disdain to write the debt down, be it small or large, along with the time it falls due: this way is more equitable in God&rsquo;s eyes, more reliable as testimony, and more likely to prevent doubts arising between you. But if the merchandise is there and you hand it over, there is no blame on you if you do not write it down. Have witnesses present whenever you trade with one another, and let no harm be done to either scribe or witness, for if you did cause them harm, it would be a crime on your part. Be mindful of God, and He will teach you: He has full knowledge of everything26:T3648,<entryFree id="n13918" key="ذَكَرَهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>1</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, [aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">ذَكُرَ</orth>
                  </form>,] inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرَى</foreign>, (S, A, Msb,) which is fem., (Msb,) and imperfectly decl., (S,) and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> (A, K) [and <foreign lang="ar">ذُكْرٌ</foreign>, or, accord. to EtTebreezee, (Ham p. 26,) the latter of these two but not the former, or, as is said in the Msb., both are properly substs., and a distinction is made between them, as will be shown below,] and <foreign lang="ar">تَذْكَارٌ</foreign>, (K,) <hi rend="ital">He preserved it in his memory:</hi> (K, * TA:) <hi rend="ital">he remembered it;</hi> (S, A;) as also <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ بِقَلْبِهِ</foreign> [to distinguish it from <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَ</foreign> in a sense afterwards to be explained], (S, Msb,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-1" target="تذكّرهُ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13918"/></foreign>; (S, A;) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-2" target="اِدَّكَرَهُ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> (S, K, TA,) originally <foreign lang="ar">اِذْتَكَرَهُ</foreign> (S,) and <foreign lang="ar">اِذَّكَرَهُ</foreign> (TA, and so in the CK,) and <foreign lang="ar">اِذْدَكَرَهُ</foreign> (K,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-3" target="استذكرهُ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (AZ, K,) signify the same as <foreign lang="ar">تذكّرهُ</foreign> (K) [as explained above]:   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-4" target="تذكّرهُ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13918"/></foreign> signifies also <hi rend="ital">he became reminded of it;</hi> (Msb;) [and so   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-5" target="ادّكرهُ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> and its variations: and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-6" target="استذكرهُ" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> seems properly to signify, as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-7" target="تذكرّهُ" n="7" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, <hi rend="ital">he recollected it;</hi> or <hi rend="ital">called it to mind:</hi> and <hi rend="ital">he sought to remember it:</hi> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-8" target="استذكر" n="8" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-9" target="تذكّر" n="9" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13918"/></foreign> used intransitively, <hi rend="ital">he sought,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">endeavoured, to remember.</hi>] You say, <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرْتُ الشَّىْءَ بَعْدَ النِّسْيَانِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I remembered the thing after forgetting</hi>]: (S:) and <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرْتُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">المَنْسِىَّ</foreign> and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-10" target="تَذَكَّرْتُهُ" n="10" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> [<hi rend="ital">I remembered the thing forgotten,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">I became reminded of it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">I recollected it</hi>]: (A:) and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-11" target="ادّكر" n="11" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>بَعْدَ أَمَهٍ</foreign>, occurring in the Kur [xii. 45, accord. to one reading of the last word], means <hi rend="ital">He remembered</hi> [or <hi rend="ital">became reminded</hi>] <hi rend="ital">after forgetting.</hi> (S) And <foreign lang="ar">رَبَطَ فِى إِصْبَعِهِ خَيْطًا <ref cref="n13918-12" target="يَسْتَذْكِرُ" n="12" type="6" subtype="FTFSO" lang="ar"/> بِهِ حَاجَتِهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He tied upon his finger a thread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">string, seeking to remember,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">recollect,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">call to mind, thereby the thing that he wanted:</hi> such a thread or string is commonly called <foreign lang="ar">رَتِيمَةٌ</foreign>:]: (AZ:) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-13" target="استذكر" n="13" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> is used alone with the like signification [i. e. <hi rend="ital">He sought to remember</hi>]: and also signifies <hi rend="ital">He studied</hi> a book <hi rend="ital">and preserved it in his memory,</hi> accord. to the K; but accord. to other lexicons, <hi rend="ital">he studied</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">in order to remember it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi> it <hi rend="ital">in his memory:</hi> (TA:) you say, <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13918-14" target="استذكر" n="14" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>بِدِرَاسَتِهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He sought to remember by his studying</hi> of a book. (A.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَ حَقَّهُ</foreign>, (K,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> (TA,) <hi rend="ital">He was mindful of his right,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">claim; and did not neglect it.</hi> (K.) Agreeably with this explanation, the words in the Kur [ii. 231, &amp;c.,] <foreign lang="ar">وَٱذْكُرُوا نِعْمَةَ ٱللّٰهِ عَلَيْكُمْ</foreign> have been rendered <hi rend="ital">And be ye mindful of, and neglect not to be thankful for, the favour of God conferred upon you:</hi> like as an Arab says to his companion, <foreign lang="ar">اُذْكُرْ حَقِّىعَلَيْكَ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Be thou mindful of my claim upon thee; and neglect it not.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  [In like manner also are explained the words] <foreign lang="ar">وَٱذْكُرُوا مَا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">فِيهِ</foreign> in the Kur [ii. 60], <hi rend="ital">And study ye what is in it, and forget it not:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">think ye upon what is in it:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">do ye what is in it.</hi> (Bd.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  One says, <foreign lang="ar">مَا ٱسْمُكَ أَذْكُرْ</foreign>, (Fs and Lb, and so in a copy of the K,) or <foreign lang="ar">أَذْكُرْهُ</foreign>, (so in another copy of the K, and in the TA,) the hemzeh of <foreign lang="ar">أَذْكُرْ</foreign> being disjunctive, (Lb, K,) [in the CK we find <foreign lang="ar">مَا اسمُكَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">اَذْكِرْهُ بقطعِ الهَمْزَةِ مِنْ اَذْكَر</foreign>, as though the reading were <foreign lang="ar">أَذْكَرْهُ</foreign> with a disjunctive hemzeh from <foreign lang="ar">أَذْكَرَ</foreign>, which is manifestly wrong,] and with fet-h, because it is the hemzeh of the first person of a triliteral [unaugmented] verb, and with the <foreign lang="ar">ر</foreign> mejzoom, because it is the complement of an interrogative phrase: (Lb:) it is expressive of disapprobation, (Lb, K,) and means, <hi rend="ital">Acquaint me with thy name:</hi> [or, lit., <hi rend="ital">what is thy name?</hi>] <hi rend="ital">I will remember it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">I will bear it in mind</hi> (<foreign lang="ar">اذكره</foreign>): the conditional phrase [if thou tell it to me] is suppressed because unnecessary, on account of frequent usage of the saying, and because what remains is indicative of it: (Lb, MF:) the saying is a prov.; and is also related with the conjunctive hemzeh, [<foreign lang="ar">ٱذْكُرْ</foreign>, or <foreign lang="ar">ٱذْكُرْ</foreign>; in which case it is most appropriately rendered, <hi rend="ital">What is thy name? Say:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Tell it</hi>] but the reading with the disjunctive hemzeh is that which is commonly known: (TA:) [for]       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ</foreign>, aor.      
    <form n="infl">       
                     <orth orig="Bu" lang="ar">ذَكُرَ</orth>
                  </form>, (TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرَى</foreign>, fem., [and imperfectly decl,] (Msb,) and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">ذُكْرٌ</foreign>, (TA,) [or the former of these two (which is the most common of all) but not the latter, or, as is said in the Msb, both are properly substs., and a distinction is made between them, as will be shown below,] also signifies <hi rend="ital">He mentioned it; told it; related it; said it;</hi> (TA;) and so <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ بِلِسَانِهِ</foreign> [to distinguish it from <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَ</foreign> in the first sense explained above]. (S, Msb.) You say <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرْتُ لِفُلَانٍ حَدِيثَ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">كَذَاوَكَذَا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">I mentioned,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">told,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">related, to such a one the story of such and such things.</hi> (TA.) And <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَ ٱمْرَأُ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">He mentioned,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spoke of, a man as having that attribute which was not in him</hi>]. (El-Jámi' es-Sagheer voce <foreign lang="ar">مَنْ</foreign>)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">He magnified Him,</hi> namely, God; <hi rend="ital">celebrated, lauded,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">praised, Him; asserted his unity;</hi> (Zj;) [saying <foreign lang="ar">سُبْحَانَ ٱللّٰهِ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">الحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">اَللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ</foreign>; or <foreign lang="ar">لَاإِلَاهَ إِلَّاٱللّٰهُ</foreign>; or <foreign lang="ar">هُوَٱللّٰهُ</foreign>; or the like.]          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  [And, in like manner, <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">He spoke well of him,</hi> namely, a man; <hi rend="ital">mentioned him with approbation; eulogized, praised,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commended, him:</hi> for <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ بِالجَمِيلِ</foreign>, or <foreign lang="ar">بِخَيْرٍ</foreign> See <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> below.]          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Also, contr., [for <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">بِالقَبِيحِ</foreign> or <foreign lang="ar">بِشَرٍّ</foreign>] <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">He spoke evil of him; men-</hi> 
                  <pb n="969"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">tioned him with evil words;</hi> (Fr;) <hi rend="ital">mentioned his vices,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">faults; spoke evil of him behind his back,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in his absence, saying of him what would grieve him if he heard it, but saying what was true;</hi> or merely <hi rend="ital">said of him what would grieve him:</hi> an elliptical expression in this and in the contrary sense; what is meant being known. (Zj.) One says to a man, <foreign lang="ar">لَئِنْ ذَكَرْتَنِى لَتَنْدَمَنَّ</foreign>, meaning [<hi rend="ital">Verily, if thou mention me</hi>] <hi rend="ital">with evil words</hi> [<hi rend="ital">thou will assuredly repent</hi>]: and in like manner the verb is used in the Kur xxi. 37 and 61: and 'Antarah says, <quote>
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">لَاتَذْكُرِى فَرَسِى وَمَا أَطْعَمْتُهُ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                     <L>
                        <foreign lang="ar">فَيَكُونَ جِلْدُكَ مِثْلَ جِلْدِ الأَجْرَبِ</foreign>
                     </L> 
                  </quote> meaning <hi rend="ital">Mention thou not reproachfully</hi> [<hi rend="ital">my horse, and what I have given him for food, for,</hi> if thou do, <hi rend="ital">thy skin will be like the skin of the scabby</hi>]: (Fr, T:) but AHeyth disallows this signification of the verb, and explains the saying of 'Antarah as meaning, <hi rend="ital">Be not thou fond of mentioning my horse,</hi> and my preferring him before the family. (T, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَ فُلَانَةَ</foreign>, inf. n <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign>, [expressly said to be] with kesr, [so in the CK, and I think it the right reading,] or <foreign lang="ar">ذَكْرٌ</foreign>, [so in a MS. copy of the K, and in the TA,] with fet-h, [so in the TA,] <hi rend="ital">He demanded such a one in marriage:</hi> or <hi rend="ital">he addressed himself to demand her in marriage:</hi> (K:) [as though the mentioning a woman implied a desire to demand her in marriage:] it occurs in one of these two senses in a trad. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرَهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">ذَكْرٌ</foreign>, with fet-h, <hi rend="ital">He struck him upon his penis.</hi> (K.)    </entryFree>27:Td11,<entryFree id="n13919" key="ذكّرهُ إِيَّاهُ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>2</itype>        
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">ذكّرهُ إِيَّاهُ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form>, (S, A, * Msb, K,) and <foreign lang="ar">ذكّرهُ بِهِ</foreign>, (Kur xiv. 5, &amp;c.,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَذْكِرَةٌ</foreign> (A, TA) and <foreign lang="ar">تَذْكِيرٌ</foreign>, (K, TA,) and quasi-inf. n.   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13919-1" target="ذِكْرَى" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13935"/></foreign> imperfectly decl.; (A, * K, * TA;) and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13919-2" target="اذكرهُ" n="2" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>ايّاهُ</foreign>; (S, Msb, K;) <hi rend="ital">He reminded him of,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caused him to remember, him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> (S, Msb, K.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">ذكّر</foreign>, (TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَذْكِيرٌ</foreign> (K) [and <foreign lang="ar">تَذْكِرَةٌ</foreign> also, as in the Kur xx. 2], <hi rend="ital">He exhorted; admonished; exhorted to obedience; gave good advice, and reminded of the results of affairs; reminded of what might soften the heart, by the mention of rewards and punishments.</hi> (K, TA.) Thus the verb is used in the Kur lxxxviii. 21. (TA.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Also <foreign lang="ar">ذكّرهُ</foreign>, inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَذْكِيرُ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">He made it</hi> (a word) <hi rend="ital">masculine; contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَنَّثَهُ</foreign>. (S, * Msb, K. *)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  In the Kur [ii. 282], <foreign lang="ar">فَتُذَكِّرَ إِحْدَاهُمَا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الأُخْرَى</foreign> is said by some to signify <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">That one of them may make the other to be in the legal predicament of a male:</hi> [meaning that both of them together shall be as one man:] or, accord. to others, <hi rend="ital">one of them may remind the other.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  It is said in a trad., <foreign lang="ar">القُرْآنُ <ref cref="n13919-3" target="ذَكَرٌ" n="3" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar" select="n13926"/>فَذَكِّرُوهُ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">The Kur-án is eminently excellent</hi> [lit., <hi rend="ital">masculine</hi>]: <hi rend="ital">therefore do ye hold it and know it and describe it as such.</hi> (K, TA. [In the CK, for <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرٌ</foreign> is put <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign>.])          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  [Hence,] <foreign lang="ar">ذكّرهُ</foreign>, (TA,) inf. n. <foreign lang="ar">تَذْكِيرٌ</foreign>, (K,) <hi rend="ital">He put to it,</hi> namely a sword, (TA,) and the head of an axe &amp;c., (K,) <hi rend="ital">an edge of steel.</hi> (K, * TA.) [See <foreign lang="ar">ذُكْرَةٌ</foreign>.]    </entryFree>28:T47b,<entryFree id="n13920-3" key="أَذْكَرَ">     
                  <form>       
                     <itype>4</itype>        
                     <orth lang="ar">أَذْكَرَ</orth>
                  </form> see 2.       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">اذكر</foreign> also signifies <hi rend="ital">He</hi> (a man [or other]) <hi rend="ital">begat a male.</hi> (TA from a trad.) And <foreign lang="ar">اذكرت</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">She</hi> (a woman, S, A, or other female, TA) <hi rend="ital">brought forth a male,</hi> (S, A, K,) or <hi rend="ital">males.</hi> (Mgh.) It is said in a prayer for a woman in labour, <foreign lang="ar">أَيْسَرَتْ وَأَذْكَرَتْ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">May she have an easy birth, and may she bring forth a male child.</hi> (A.) And you say also, <foreign lang="ar">اذكرت بِهِ</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">She brought him forth a male, and hardy:</hi> (TA from a trad.:) or <hi rend="ital">a male, and sharp and cunning.</hi> (Mgh.)    </entryFree>29:T29a6,<entryFree id="n13925" key="ذِكْرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> (Yoo, A'Obeyd, Yaakoob, S, M, A, Msb, K) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-1" target="ذُكْرٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13924"/></foreign>, (Yoo, A'Obeyd, Yaakoob, S, A, Msb, K, TA,) or the latter only in the first of the senses here to be explained, (Fr, Msb, TA,) and the latter only is mentioned in this sense in the Fs, (TA,) and is said by El-Ahmar to be of the dial. of Kureysh, (TA,) [both said in the Msb to be simple substs., though many hold them to be inf. ns.,] and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-2" target="ذَكْرٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13923"/></foreign>, accord. to one of the expositors of the Fs, but this is strange, (TA,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-3" target="ذِكْرَةٌ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13932"/></foreign> (S, M) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-4" target="ذُكْرَةٌ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13931"/></foreign> (M, TA) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-5" target="ذِكْرَى" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13935"/></foreign>, (S, M, [see 1, first sentence,]) and also <foreign lang="ar">دِكْرٌ</foreign> (S) and <foreign lang="ar">دُكْرٌ</foreign>, mentioned by ISd as of the dial. of Rabee'ah, but held by him to be of weak authority, (TA,) <hi rend="ital">Remembrance;</hi> (S, M, A, Msb, K, &amp;c.;) the <hi rend="ital">presence</hi> of a thing <hi rend="ital">in the mind:</hi> (Er-Rághib:) also termed <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ بِالقَلْبِ</foreign>, (Msb, TA,) to distinguish it from <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> in another sense, to be explained below: (TA:) he pl. of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-6" target="ذِكْرَةٌ" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13932"/></foreign> is <foreign lang="ar">ذِكَرٌ</foreign>, (M,) also said to be pl. of   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-7" target="ذِكْرَى" n="7" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13935"/></foreign>. (MF, art. <foreign lang="ar">احد</foreign>.) You say,   
      <foreign lang="ar">اِجْعَلْهُ مِنْكَ عَلَى <ref cref="n13925-8" target="ذُكْرٍ" n="8" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٍ</foreign> in the same sense, <hi rend="ital">Place thou him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, in thy remembrance.</hi> (S.) And <foreign lang="ar">عَلَى <ref cref="n13925-9" target="ذُكْرٍ" n="9" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>أَجْعَلَهُ مِنِّى</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٍ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">I will not forget him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> (A.) And   
      <foreign lang="ar">مَا زَالَ مِنِّى عَلَى <ref cref="n13925-10" target="ذُكْرٍ" n="10" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٍ</foreign> (K,) or the former only, (Fr, Msb, TA,) <hi rend="ital">He,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it, did not cease to be in my remembrance;</hi> (K;) <hi rend="ital">I did not forget him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> (Fr, TA.) And   
      <foreign lang="ar">أَنْتَ مِنِّى عَلَى <ref cref="n13925-11" target="ذُكْرٍ" n="11" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">Thou art in my mind.</hi> (ISd, Lb.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  The words in the Kur [xxix. 44] <foreign lang="ar">وَلَذِكْرُ ٱللّٰهِ أَكْبَرُ</foreign> admit of two explanations: <hi rend="ital">The remembrance of God is better</hi> for a man than a man's remembrance of a man: and <hi rend="ital">the remembrance of God is better</hi> as more efficacious in forbidding evil conduct than is prayer. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> also signifies <hi rend="ital">Memory; a certain quality of the mind, by which a man is able to remember what he cares to know;</hi> like <foreign lang="ar">حِفُظٌ</foreign>, except that this latter term is used with regard to the preservation of a thing [in the mind], whereas the former is used with regard to calling it to mind. (Er-Rághib.)       <sense type="A" n="2">-A2-</sense>  Also <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> (Er-Rághib, Msb, TA) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-12" target="ذُكْرٌ" n="12" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13924"/></foreign>, (Msb, TA,) or the former only accord. to Fr, (Msb, TA,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-13" target="ذِكْرَى" n="13" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13935"/></foreign> (Msb,) The <hi rend="ital">mention, telling, relating,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">saying,</hi> of a thing: said by some to be <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">صَمْتٌ</foreign>: (TA:) and also termed <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ بِاللِّسَانِ</foreign> (Msb, TA,) to distinguish it from <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> in the sense first explained above. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرٌ</foreign> <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  The <hi rend="ital">praise,</hi> and <hi rend="ital">glorification, of God;</hi> the <hi rend="ital">celebration,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">declaration, of his remoteness,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">freedom, from every impurity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imperfection,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from everything derogatory from his glory;</hi> or the <hi rend="ital">saying</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">سُبْحَانَ</foreign>, <foreign lang="ar">ٱللّٰهِ</foreign>, [<hi rend="ital">and</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">الحَمْدُ لِلّٰهِ</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَللّٰهُ أَكْبَرُ</foreign>,] <hi rend="ital">and</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">لَا إِلَاهَ إِلَّا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ٱللّٰهُ</foreign>, [&amp;c., see 1,] <hi rend="ital">and uttering all the forms of his praise: a reading,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reciting, of the Kur-án: a thanking</hi> [<hi rend="ital">God</hi>]: <hi rend="ital">obedience</hi> [<hi rend="ital">to God</hi>]: (Abu-l- 'Abbás:) <hi rend="ital">prayer to God;</hi> (K;) <hi rend="ital">supplication.</hi> (Abu-l-'Abbás, K.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  Also <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Praise,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eulogy,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">good speech,</hi> of another. (S, * K, * TA.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  [And, accord. to some, <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Dispraise,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">evil speech.</hi> See 1.]          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  Also <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">A thing that is current upon the tongue.</hi> (K.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Fame; renown; report; reputation;</hi> (S, A, K;) <hi rend="ital">whether good or evil;</hi> (ISd;) as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13925-14" target="ذُكْرَةٌ" n="14" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13931"/></foreign>. (AZ, ISd, K.) Thus in the saying, <foreign lang="ar">لَهُ ذِكْرٌ فِى النَّاسِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">He has fame among the people:</hi> in which it has also the signification next following. (A.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Eminence; nobility; honour.</hi> (S, A, Msb, K.) So in the Kur [xciv. 4], <foreign lang="ar">وَرَفَعْنَا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">لَكَ ذِكْرَكَ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">And We have raised for thee thine eminence,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thy nobility,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thine honour:</hi> as some say, it means, when I am mentioned, thou art mentioned with Me: and again, in the Kur [xliii. 43], <foreign lang="ar">وَ إِنَّهُ لَذِكْرٌ لَكَ وَ لِقَوْمِكَ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">And verily it</hi> (the Kur-án) <hi rend="ital">is an honour to thee and to thy people.</hi> (TA.) Also, in the Kur [xxxviii. 1], <foreign lang="ar">وَ القُرْآنِ ذِى الذِّكْرِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">By the Kur-án possessed of eminence, &amp;c.</hi> (S)          <sense type="b" n="8">-b8-</sense>  Also <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">A book containing an exposition of religion, and an institution of religious laws:</hi> (K:) <hi rend="ital">any book of the prophets:</hi> (TA:) and especially the <hi rend="ital">Kur-án:</hi> (MF, TA:) and the <foreign lang="ar">تَوْرَاةٌ</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">Book of the Law revealed to Moses</hi>]: (Aboo-Hureyreh, TA in art. <foreign lang="ar">زبر</foreign>:) and that [<hi rend="ital">law</hi>] <hi rend="ital">which is</hi> [<hi rend="ital">recorded</hi>] <hi rend="ital">in heaven.</hi> (Sa'eed Ibn-Jubeyr, TA ubi suprà.)          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  <assumedtropical>(assumed tropical:)</assumedtropical>  <hi rend="ital">An exhortation; an admonition,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a warning.</hi> (Bd in xxxviii. 1.)          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرُ حَقٍّ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">A written obligation;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">صَكٌّ</foreign>: (A, K:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورُ حَقٍّ</foreign>, (A,) or <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورُ حُقُوقٍ</foreign>. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">لِى عَلَى هٰذَا الأَمْرِ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ذِكْرُ حَقٍّ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  [<hi rend="ital">I have a written obligation to insure this thing</hi>]. (A.)       <sense type="A" n="3">-A3-</sense>  See also the next paragraph, in the latter half.    </entryFree>2a:T2ac5,<entryFree id="n13926" key="ذَكَرٌ" type="main">     
                  <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">ذَكَرٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> [probably originally signifying “ mentioned, ” or “ talked of, ” of the measure <foreign lang="ar">فَعَلٌ</foreign> in the sense of the measure <foreign lang="ar">مَفْعُولٌ</foreign>, like <foreign lang="ar">نَفَضٌ</foreign> in the <pb n="970"/> sense of <foreign lang="ar">مَنْفُوضٌ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">خَبَطٌ</foreign> in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">مَخْبُوطٌ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">قَبَضٌ</foreign> in the sense of <foreign lang="ar">مَقْبُوضٌ</foreign>, &amp;c.; and hence the first, and perhaps most others, of the significations here following:] <hi rend="ital">Male; masculine; of the male,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">masculine, sex,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gender; contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أُنْثَى</foreign>: (S, A, Msb, K, &amp;c.:) [the corresponding word in Hebrew (<G/>) has been supposed to have this signification because a male is much “ mentioned, ” or “ talked of; ” and it is well known that the Arabs make comparatively little account of a female:] pl. <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورٌ</foreign> (S, A, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورَةٌ</foreign> (A, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكَارٌ</foreign> (K) and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكَارَةٌ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">ذُكْرَانٌ</foreign> (S, A, Msb, K) and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكَرَةٌ</foreign>: (S, K:) [the last, in one copy of the S, I find written   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-1" target="ذِكْرَةٌ" n="1" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13932"/></foreign>, which, if correct, is a pl. of pauc.: and in the TA, in the same phrase in which it occurs in the S, it is written   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-2" target="ذُكْرَةٌ" n="2" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13931"/></foreign>, and expressly said to be with damm, so that it is a quasi-pl. n.:] the pl. form with <foreign lang="ar">و</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">ن</foreign> is not allowable. (Msb.) One says, <foreign lang="ar">كَمِ الذِّكَرَةُ مِنْ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">وَلَدِكَ</foreign>, or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-3" target="الذِّكْرَةُ" n="3" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, (accord. to different copies of the S,) or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-4" target="الذُّكْرَةُ" n="4" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign>, with damm, (accord. to the TA,) <hi rend="ital">How many are the males of thy children?</hi> (S, TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  The <hi rend="ital">male organ of generation;</hi> the <hi rend="ital">penis;</hi> syn. <foreign lang="ar">عَوْفٌ</foreign>; (S, K, &amp;c.;) of a man: (TA:) or the <foreign lang="ar">فَرْج</foreign> [an equivocal term, but here evidently used in the above-mentioned sense,] of an animal: (Msb:) pl. <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورٌ</foreign>, (K,) or <foreign lang="ar">ذِكَرَةٌ</foreign>, like <foreign lang="ar">عِنَبَةٌ</foreign>, (Msb,) or <foreign lang="ar">ذِكَارَةٌ</foreign>, (T, TA,) and   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-5" target="مَذَاكِيرُ" n="5" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13948"/></foreign>: (S, Msb, K:) the last contr. to analogy, (S, Msb,) as though used for the sake of distinction between this signification and the one immediately preceding: (S:) or of the same class as <foreign lang="ar">مَحَاسِنُ</foreign> [with respect to <foreign lang="ar">حُسْنٌ</foreign>] and <foreign lang="ar">مَلَامِحُ</foreign> [with respect to <foreign lang="ar">لَمْحَةٌ</foreign>]: (ISd:) Akh says that it is a pl. without a [proper] sing., like <foreign lang="ar">عَبَابِيدُ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar">أَبَابِيلُ</foreign>: accord. to the T, it has no sing.; or if it have a sing., it is   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-6" target="مُذْكِرٌ" n="6" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13944"/></foreign>, like <foreign lang="ar">مُقْدِمٌ</foreign>, of which the pl. is <foreign lang="ar">مَقَادِيمُ</foreign>; and signifies the <hi rend="ital">parts next to the penis:</hi> (TA:) or it signifies the <hi rend="ital">penis with what is around it;</hi> [or the <hi rend="ital">genitals;</hi>] and is similar to <foreign lang="ar">مَفَارِقُ</foreign> in the phrase <foreign lang="ar">شَابَتْ مَفَارِقُ</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">رَأْسِهِ</foreign>: and <foreign lang="ar">قَطَعَ مَذَاكِيرَهُ</foreign> signified <hi rend="ital">He extirpated his penis.</hi> (Mgh.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  Applied to a man, (A, K,) it also signifies <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Strong; courageous; acute and ardent; vigorous and effective in affairs;</hi> [and also] <hi rend="ital">stubborn; and disdainful:</hi> (TA:) or [<hi rend="ital">masculine,</hi> meaning] <hi rend="ital">perfect;</hi> like as <foreign lang="ar">أُنْثَى</foreign> is applied to a woman. (T and A in art. <foreign lang="ar">انث</foreign>.) The signification of “ strong, courageous, and stubborn, ” and the significations which the same word has when applied to rain and to a saying, are assigned in the K to   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-7" target="ذِكْرٌ" n="7" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13925"/></foreign>; but [SM says,] I know not how this is; for in the other lexicons they are assigned to <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرٌ</foreign>. (TA.) You say, <foreign lang="ar">لَا يَفْعَلُهُ إِلَّا</foreign> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورَةُ الرِّجَالِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  [<hi rend="ital">None will do it but such as are strong,</hi> &amp;c., <hi rend="ital">of men</hi>]. (A.)          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  Applied to iron, <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Of the toughest and best quality,</hi> (K,) <hi rend="ital">and strongest;</hi> (TA;) <hi rend="ital">contr. of</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">أَنِيثٌ</foreign>; (S;) [iron <hi rend="ital">converted into steel;</hi>] as also   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-8" target="ذَكِيرٌ" n="8" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar" select="n13936"/></foreign>. (K.)                   <foreign lang="ar">مَآء</foreign> [i. e., <hi rend="ital">diversified wavy marks, streaks,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grain</hi>]; (S;) as also

                  <foreign lang="ar">مَتْن</foreign> [or <hi rend="ital">middle of the broad side</hi>] <hi rend="ital">of soft iron;</hi> of which the people say that they are of the fabric of the Jinn, or Genii: (A'Obeyd, S:) or   
      <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n13926-10" target="مُذَكَّرُ" n="10" type="1" subtype="WO" lang="ar"/></foreign> signifies <hi rend="ital">having a sharp iron blade or edge:</hi> (As:) the pl. of the former is <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورٌ</foreign>. (Ham p. 168.)          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورُ البُقُولِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Herbs,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leguminous plants, that are hard and thick:</hi> (TA voce <foreign lang="ar">عُشْبٌ</foreign>:) or <hi rend="ital">that are thick, and inclining to bitterness:</hi> (S, TA:) like as <foreign lang="ar">أَحْرَارُهَا</foreign> signifies such as are slender and sweet: (TA:) or the former signifies <hi rend="ital">such as are thick and rough.</hi> (AHeyth.)          <sense type="b" n="7">-b7-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورَةُ الطِّيبِ</foreign>, (K,) and <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُورُهُ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">ذِكَارَتُهُ</foreign>, (TA,) <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Perfume proper for men, exclusively of women:</hi> i. e., (TA,) <hi rend="ital">that leaves no stain;</hi> (K, * TA;) <hi rend="ital">that becomes dissipated;</hi> such as musk, and aloes-wood, and camphire, and <foreign lang="ar">غَالِيَة</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">ذَرِيرَة</foreign>. See 2.          <sense type="b" n="9">-b9-</sense>  Applied to a saying, <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Strong and firm:</hi> and in like manner to poetry. (A.)          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  The Arabs disliked a she-camel's bringing forth a male; and hence they applied the term <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرٌ</foreign>, met., to <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  Anything <hi rend="ital">disliked.</hi> (A.)          <sense type="b" n="11">-b11-</sense>  [Thus,] applied to rain, it signifies <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Violent;</hi> (A, K;) <hi rend="ital">falling in large drops.</hi> (K.) They said, <foreign lang="ar">أَصَابَتِ الأَرْضَ ذُكُورُ الأَسْمِيَةِ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">Rains bringing intense cold and torrents fell upon the earth.</hi> (A.)          <sense type="b" n="12">-b12-</sense>  Applied to a day, <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  [<hi rend="ital">Severe; distressing; hard to be borne:</hi> see also <foreign lang="ar">مُذَكَّرٌ</foreign>]. (A.)          <sense type="b" n="13">-b13-</sense>  IDrd says, I think that the name <foreign lang="ar">الذكر</foreign> [so in the TA, without any syll. signs; app. <foreign lang="ar">الذَّكَرُ</foreign>] is applied by some of the Arabs to <foreign lang="ar">السِّمَاكُ الرَّامِحُ</foreign> [or the star <hi rend="ital">Arcturus</hi>].                   <form>       
                     <orth orig="" extent="full" lang="ar">مِذْكَارٌ</orth>
                     <orth extent="full" lang="ar">ذ</orth>
                  </form> A woman [or other female] <hi rend="ital">that usually brings forth males.</hi> (S, K.) And A man <hi rend="ital">who usually begets male children.</hi> (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  Also <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  Land <hi rend="ital">that produces herbs,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leguminous plants, such as are termed</hi> 
                  <foreign lang="ar">ذُكُور</foreign>: (A, TA: [see <foreign lang="ar">مُذْكِرٌ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">ذَكَرٌ</foreign>:]) or <hi rend="ital">that does not produce</hi> [<hi rend="ital">anything</hi>]: but the former signification is the more common. (TA.)          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  And <foreign lang="ar">فَلَاةٌ مِذْكَارٌ</foreign> <tropical>(tropical:)</tropical>  <hi rend="ital">A terrible desert;</hi> (As, A, K;) <hi rend="ital">that is not traversed but by strong, courageous, stubborn men.</hi> (As, K.)
